title: Thousands of JFK assassination documents released
US Patriots could protect Ukraine's power grid; Russia threatens 'unpredictable consequences'
description: Russia's attacks on Ukraine's power grid are targeting the entire population, casting people into darkness and cold, and pushing the US closer to sending the Patriot missile defense system long sought by Ukraine's government.

title: Enhanced defense partnership with Taiwan is part of $858 billion US defense bill
description: Congress is on its way to passing a bipartisan $858 billion defense bill that would give service members a hefty pay raise, bolster support for Ukraine and Taiwan, and rescind the US military's Covid-19 vaccine mandate.

title: CNN Exclusive: Pelosi and Schumer say Biden should run for re-election in 2024
description: In an exclusive interview with CNN's Jamie Gangel, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer discuss the 2024 election and a possible rematch between President Biden and former President Trump.

title: Exploding gift sends Polish police chief to hospital after Ukraine visit
description: Poland's police chief Jaroslaw Szymczyk was hospitalized with minor injuries on Wednesday after a gift that he had received in Ukraine suddenly exploded, according to a government statement

title: 'Rail cars' of material released after NASA spacecraft hit asteroid
description: When NASA's Double Asteroid Redirection Test spacecraft slammed into the tiny asteroid Dimorphos, the impact certainly left a mark.

title: Former Twitter employee sentenced to more than three years in prison in Saudi spy case
description: A former Twitter manager convicted of spying for Saudi Arabia was sentenced on Wednesday to more than three years in prison.

title: 'Putin killed off Russian culture,' Ukranian and Russian authors on ten months of war
description: Ukrainian novelist Andrey Kurkov and historian Nina Khrushcheva talk to Christiane Amanpour about how Russian and Ukraine have changed after nearly a year of war.

title: CDC: Room spray linked to deadly multistate outbreak last year also killed raccoon
description: Humans weren't the only ones that lost their lives after being exposed to an aromatherapy spray linked to fatal cases of a rare tropical disease. The disease also killed a family's pet raccoon in Texas.

title: Jealousy, lies and backstabbing: Harry and Meghan point the finger in final Netflix episodes
description: • What we learned from Harry and Meghan's Netflix documentary

title: 'It's a game of chess': Retired general explains the use of Patriot missiles
description: Retired Major General James "Spider" Marks joins CNN's Kate Bolduan to explain the significance of the Biden administration finalizing plans to send the Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine, according to two US officials and a senior administration official.

title: Dad's evil ornament business thrives after daughter's viral video
description: Freaky Christmas ornaments saved by daughter's devotion to dad. Is that a serial killer hanging on your tree? CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Real Madrid signs highly touted 16-year-old for reported $63.6 million fee
description: Real Madrid has signed the highly-touted 16-year-old Brazilian forward Endrick from Brazilian club Palmeiras, both clubs announced on Thursday.

title: EU court sides with FIFA and UEFA in Super League row
description: The decisions taken by soccer bodies FIFA and UEFA to block the European Super League (ESL) are in line with European Union (EU) competition laws, according to an EU Opinion issued on Thursday.

title: Moderate Republicans discuss how to strike back at 'Never Kevin' rebels
description: As frustration inside the House GOP has grown over a small band of anti-Kevin McCarthy lawmakers, an idea to strike back at the rebellious group has been floated among some Republicans: kicking these members off their committees, according to multiple members involved in the conversations.

title: Ukraine launches 'most massive strike' on occupied Donetsk since 2014, Russia-installed mayor says
description: Ukrainian forces have unleashed the biggest attack on the occupied Donetsk region since 2014, according to a Russia-installed official, in the wake of heavy fighting in the east of the country.

title: Champion adaptive surfer knows the power of resilience
description: Meira Va'a Nelson is a champion surfer who has known more trauma in her life than most people will ever experience.

title: Senate passes legislation to ban TikTok from US government devices
description: The Senate passed legislation Wednesday evening to ban TikTok from US government devices, in a move designed to limit perceived information-security risks stemming from the social media app.

title: Giuliani violated ethics rules with 2020 election fraud claims, attorney disciplinary committee says
description: False election fraud claims that Rudy Giuliani made when he was representing former President Donald Trump's campaign in 2020 should make the former New York mayor liable for professional sanctions, an attorney disciplinary committee said Thursday.

title: Soyuz spacecraft docked to International Space Station springs 'fairly significant' coolant leak
description: A planned space walk by the Russian space agency Roscosmos has been called off following the discovery of a coolant leak coming from the Soyuz MS-22 spacecraft, which is currently docked to the International Space Station.

title: See video of leak that forced Russians to cancel spacewalk
description: A planned space walk by the Russian space agency Roscosmos was canceled following the discovery of a coolant leak coming from the Soyuz spacecraft, which is docked to the International Space Station. CNN's Kristin Fisher reports

title: Adam Sandler to receive the Mark Twain Prize for American Humor
description: Adam Sandler is being rewarded for his decades of work.

title: Central banks around the world follow the Fed in stepping down rate hikes
description: Central banks around the world are joining the Federal Reserve in slowing down the pace of interest rate hikes as inflation shows signs of easing.

title: Tennis great Boris Becker released from UK prison and due to be deported -- UK media
description: Former world No. 1 men's tennis player Boris Becker has been released from a UK prison after serving just eight months of his sentence and is due to be deported from the UK, PA Media reported on Thursday.

title: Why some men are dropping out of the workforce
description: The labor force participation rate for men ages 30 - 44 is lower than it was pre-pandemic while more women in that age group are participating at a higher rate than pre-pandemic. CNN's Vanessa Yurkevich takes a look at why.

title: tWitch's tragic death stirred public shock, expressions of grief and confusion
description: Social media was flooded Wednesday with tributes to Stephen "tWitch" Boss as everyone from Viola Davis and Channing Tatum to Michelle Obama spoke lovingly of the dancer, actor and DJ. They were simply returning a bit of the kindness and love Boss poured into the world.

title: Researchers have found that snakes have a clitoris. Here's what it could mean
description: Scientists have discovered that female snakes have a clitoris — a previously overlooked or dismissed part of their anatomy (and that of many other animals), according to a new study.

title: France and Argentina bring multiple plot lines to mouthwatering World Cup final
description: And just like that, after 62 matches over nearly a month, the stage for Qatar 2022's showpiece final was set.

title: What I learned about antisemitism with a gun pointed to my head
description: I will never forget the feeling of having a gun pointed at me. It was January 15, 2022, and I was leading morning services at Congregation Beth Israel in Colleyville, Texas.

title: Family of Palestinian activist Nizar Banat files case against Palestinian Authority in International Criminal Court
description: The family of a Palestinian activist who died while in Palestinian Authority custody has filed a "war crimes and torture" case with the International Criminal Court, they said Thursday.

title: Floor fights and House speaker elections, explained
description: Rep. Kevin McCarthy has a math problem, and he has to solve it by January 3.

title: Golf star's sister inspired him to create a charity
description: In September 2013, Jordan Spieth was powering towards one of the greatest rookie seasons golf has ever seen.

title: Jill Biden makes a tidal shift on another run at the White House
description: First lady Jill Biden, despite being so worn out from a recent circuit of White House events that she lost her voice, is now seriously looking ahead to her husband running for reelection in 2024. That's a tidal shift from her position just three months ago.

title: Hear Prince Harry discuss family conflict over departure from Royal Family
description: The second installment of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's documentary, 'Harry and Meghan' has released on Netflix. CNN's Max Foster reports.

title: University chancellor mocks Asian languages during commencement speech
description: The Chancellor of Purdue University Northwest has issued an apology after marking a racist remark about Asian languages during a commencement speech. CNN's Don Lemon has the story.

title: Elon Musk sells another 22 million Tesla shares for $3.6 billion
description: Elon Musk just sold another 22 million shares of Tesla, raising $3.6 billion.

title: Warren Buffett is beating the market this year
description: Investors around the world have been trying to adjust their portfolios to contend with big interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve, European Central Bank, Bank of England and other central banks this year. But Warren Buffett has no reason to be worried.

title: Hear how this boy stayed safe as tornado wrecked his neighborhood
description: A severe weather system has left a trail of destruction in Louisiana, killing at least three people. Violent tornadoes touched down causing collapsed homes, turning debris into projectiles and knocking out power. CNN's Nick Valencia reports from the ground.

title: Cultural review: From celebrity spectacle to art in conflict, here are the moments that shaped 2022
description: If 2021 was a tentative return to in-person gatherings and social events, then 2022 felt like a more confident reinstatement of life as we knew it. The most intense years of the Covid-19 pandemic are, in many parts of the world, fading from view, though there has been no shortage of major news events to keep us on edge.

title: The NFL rookie QB sensation who continues to prove everyone wrong
description: One has played 331 regular season games and is widely regarded as the NFL's greatest ever player. The other is making his first start in the league, having been the last player selected in the 2022 draft, earning himself the moniker, "Mr. Irrelevant."

title: Young boy killed in France after being hit by car following World Cup semifinal win
description: A young boy died after being hit by a car Wednesday evening in the southern French city of Montpellier following France's win over Morocco in the World Cup semifinal on Wednesday.

title: In car crashes, women are more likely to die than men. This new crash test dummy could help save lives
description: For women, the consequences of a car crash are often far deadlier than for men.

title: This artist paints hyperrealistic wildlife images
description: A whale shark under the waves caught in a beam of sunlight, a snow leopard striding forward with its eyes locked on yours -- these images could easily be mistaken for photographs, but in fact they were captured by the stroke of a paintbrush.

title: Russian Embassy warns of 'unpredictable consequences' if US sends Patriot missiles to Ukraine
They met on a train between Amsterdam and Berlin. They've been married for nearly 30 years.
description: Katy Vernon and Randy Vanderwood first spotted one another on a crowded station platform. It was the summer of 1991. The two strangers were waiting to board a sleeper train from Amsterdam, in the Netherlands, to the newly unified Berlin in Germany.

title: White House warns of possible Covid-19 winter surge: 'This is not one disease in isolation'
description: For Americans across the country preparing to gather and socialize with family and friends during the end-of-year holiday season, the White House has a clear warning: Covid-19 is not over, and you had better protect yourself.

title: Thai princess hospitalized with heart condition, palace says
description: Thailand's Princess Bajrakitiyabha is in a stable condition after she was hospitalized due to a heart problem, the Thai royal palace said in a statement on Thursday.

title: Harry and Meghan discuss royal split in Netflix documentary
Russia installs intercontinental missile ahead of 'Strategic Forces Day'
Harry and Meghan discuss royal split in Netflix documentary
description: The final installments of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex's controversial Netflix documentary have been released.

title: Drinkers falling asleep in the road are dying in traffic accidents, Tokyo police warn
description: Police in Japan's capital are urging people to moderate their alcohol consumption this holiday season following an increase in deaths of drinkers hit by vehicles after falling asleep on the street.

title: Ukrainians urge US to support special tribunal to prosecute Russian leadership
Russia installs intercontinental missile ahead of 'Strategic Forces Day'
Chinese student appears in US court over alleged threats to pro-democracy advocate
description: A Chinese student appeared in court in the United States on Wednesday, charged with one count of stalking after allegedly threatening and harassing someone who advocated for democracy in China, US authorities said.

title: China's economy faltered before major Covid policy shift
description: China's Covid-battered economy slumped in November before its leaders abruptly eased pandemic restrictions, paving the way for a reopening that economists say will be bumpy and painful.

title: Why voters don't want Biden or Trump but might get them anyway in 2024
description: Even as President Joe Biden and ex-President Donald Trump move toward a rerun of the most turbulent White House race in modern history, many voters are pining for a break from the past -- and the present.

title: Chinese diplomats wanted by UK police for questioning return to Beijing
description: China has removed its consul-general and five other British-based diplomats wanted by police for questioning in connection to the alleged beating of a Hong Kong protester in the English city of Manchester.

title: Henry Cavill says he will not return as Superman
description: DC fans across the globe collectively mourned Wednesday as British actor Henry Cavill said he will no longer be donning the red cape as Superman in the DC Comics extended cinematic universe.

title: For almost 160 years, a Cézanne painting had a secret hiding in plain sight
description: Cincinnati Art Museum's chief conservator Serena Urry was conducting a routine inspection of the institution's prized Paul Cézanne painting "Still Life with Bread and Eggs" when she noticed something "odd."

title: Ukrainians urge US to support special tribunal to prosecute Russian leadership
description: Ukrainian officials traveled to the United States last week to push for support for the creation of a special tribunal to prosecute top-level Russian officials for the crime of aggression.

title: American one of seven charged in Russian military grade weapon smuggling ring
description: CNN's Alex Marquardt reports on a Russian smuggling ring that has shipped millions of dollars of US manufactured military and sensitive dual-use technologies to Russian end users.

title: Hear from creator of @elonjet account after Musk suspended him
description: CNN's Donie O'Sullivan speaks with the creator of the suspended Twitter account that tracked Elon Musk's private jet.

title: Bali bomber apologizes for nightclub attacks that killed 202
description: An Indonesian bomb maker convicted for his role in the deadly 2002 Bali nightclub attacks has apologized to the victims' families, after his release from prison was met with outrage in Australia.

title: Democratic lawmakers urge Meta not to restore Trump's account in January
description: Two Democratic lawmakers on Wednesday urged Meta to maintain Donald Trump's suspension from its platforms when it revisits the matter in January, arguing that the former president's recent posts on his own social media platform suggest he is likely to violate the social media giant's policies if given a chance.

title: Nurses posted a TikTok video mocking patients. Now they're out of a job
description: Emory Healthcare says they no longer employ several labor and delivery nurses after they posted a now-viral TikTok making fun of patients.

title: House passes stopgap bill to avert shutdown at end of the week
description: The House voted Wednesday evening to pass a stopgap bill to avert a government shutdown at the end of this week with funding currently set to expire on Friday at midnight. The vote was 224 to 201 with nine Republicans joining with Democrats to vote in favor.

title: Host mother of missing US student studying in France suspects he left voluntarily. His parents have challenged that theory
description: The woman who hosted an American college student studying in France before he went missing told CNN she thinks he may have left voluntarily -- a claim echoed by a French prosecutor but challenged by both of the young man's parents.

title: Pelosi attack suspect planned to target Hunter Biden, Gavin Newsom and Tom Hanks, police official says
description: The man accused of attacking House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband, Paul, said there was "evil in Washington" and had also planned to target President Joe Biden's son Hunter, California Gov. Gavin Newsom and actor Tom Hanks, a San Francisco Police Department official testified Wednesday.
